item.title: Monopoly GO: Tycoon Cookout Rewards And Milestones
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Tycoon Cookout Monopoly GO Rewards And Milestones
  • How To Get Points In Tycoon Cookout Monopoly GO

With the Firework Fortunes solo event now over, Monopoly GO has released another thrilling event: Tycoon Cookout. Starting on July 6, 2024, it will be available for the next two days until July 8, 2024 .

As always, players can look forward to tons of goodies during this event, such as sticker packs, cash, and everyone's favorite dice rolls. Furthermore, with the Sunset Treasures mini-game underway, players can also win many Hammer tokens required for participating in the mini-game. Below, we will share all the rewards and milestones for the Tycoon Cookout solo event in Monopoly GO.

Tycoon Cookout Monopoly GO Rewards And Milestones

Here's everything available in the Tycoon Cookout event:

6,500 Free Dice Rolls

How To Get Points In Tycoon Cookout Monopoly GO

The Tycoon Cookout event contains a total of 43 milestones. Players who hit all 43 milestone levels will receive a whopping 17,630 free dice, along with 10 sticker packs, 194 Hammer Tokens for the Sunset Treasures dig mini-game, and plenty of in-game cash . Furthermore, players can also take advantage of different boosters like Mega Heist and Cash Boost as they complete milestones.

Scoring points in the Tycoon Cookout Monopoly GO event is simple. All you have to do is land on the Railroad, Community Chest, and Chance tiles . Each landing on these tiles will give you a certain number of points, which you can increase using your roll modifier. So if you have enough dice, make sure to increase your multiplier when you are six to nine tiles away from the aforementioned tiles.

The Tycoon Cookout Monopoly GO event is only around for two days, so join the event now and roll the dice before it's over.

item.title: How to Get to Northeast Area of Map in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Players wanting to explore every inch of the map in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree will find the verticality of the terrain and the looping pathways to be the biggest obstacles barring their way. Whether it is finding the way to the Ancient Ruins of Rauh or figuring out how to get to Bayle, FromSoftware is not afraid to lock progress behind easy-to-miss secrets.

Few areas in the Land of Shadow are as hard to reach as the top right corner of the map, above the Shadow Keep. The entire landmass is locked behind a Statue that will only reveal the passage behind it when players perform a specific gesture while standing in front of it.

How to Get to Top Right Corner of Map in Elden Ring DLC

The top right area of the map is called the Finger Ruins of Dheo and can only be accessed by going through Scaduview, the green strip of land before it. Here is how to get there.

Players who have already discovered the Church District can skip to step 6.

  1. Start from the Moorth Ruins Site of Grace (where you meet Dryleaf Dane) and turn east towards the ruins. There will be a small drop that leads below the ruins towards Bonny Village.
  2. In Bonny Village, head north and pick up the 'O Mother' Gesture hidden behind a few bushes (location shown above).
  3. Next, take the eastern path to reach the Bridge Leading to the Village Site of Grace.
  4. Continue north along the road until you reach a fork just after the Church District Highroad Site of Grace. South leads to the Cathedral of Manus Metyr, and west leads to the Shadow Keep underground.
  5. Head west through the tunnel, and you'll find the Church District Entrance Site of Grace.
  6. Jump across the rooftops to reach the church on the left side and drop down to the archway from the hole in the roof (route detailed above).
  7. Proceed down the tunnel with the two Fire Knights, and you'll find three doors turning right. Use the last one to reach a lift that takes you up to the Storehouse, Back Section Site of Grace.
  8. From here, take the ladder to your right to reach the next section. Turn right from the Fire Knight and take the staircase to the library above. There is a hole in the wall to the right just ahead. Jump through it and continue down the scaffolding to reach the Storehouse, Loft Site of Grace.
  9. Use the elevator just ahead to reach the rafters at the very top. The goal here is to reach the balcony on the other side of the room (north). To do so, climb the rafters and turn right. It'll lead you directly above the balcony.
  10. Jump down and exit out the back to reach the path circling the outside of the keep. This path will lead you to the Storehouse, Back Gate Site of Grace.
  11. Directly in front of you is the Commander Gaius boss fight, but to the right will be a Statue of Marika.
  12. Stand in front of the Statue and use the 'O Mother' Gesture you picked up in Bonny Village. The Statue will shift to the side, revealing a hidden path behind it.
  13. Continue downward to discover the Hinterlands Site of Grace. Now, the top right of the map is open to you.

The hilltop to the right leads to Shaman Village, the birthplace of Marika, and crossing the bridge to the north leads to the Finger Ruins of Dheo, where players will need to ring the second bell for the Count Ymir questline. A Fallingstar Beast can also be found just before the Finger Ruins.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Every Stat, Explained
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Base Stats
  • Agent Specialty
  • Damage-Deal Type
  • Additional Agent Abilities

Zenless Zone Zero may not feature intricate RPG mechanics, but the extensive list of Agents' Stats can confuse newcomers, leaving many puzzled by terms like Anomaly Mastery and Impact. To help with this, the following guide clarifies every Stat in Zenless Zone Zero , simplifying their gameplay effects.

Base Stats

Base Stats are universal among all Agents in Zenless Zone Zero , and they indicate the power, durability, and agility of a character. There are ten stat categories that players must be aware of: HP, ATK, DEF, Impact, CRIT Rate and Damage, PEN and PEN Ratio, Energy Regeneration and Energy Regeneration Rate, Anomaly Mastery, Anomaly Proficiency, and Attribute Damage Bonus.

  • HP : Determines the Agent’s health points.
  • ATK : Shows the Agent’s power and damage.
  • DEF : Indicates the Agent’s durability.
  • Impact : Accelerates Daze accumulation.
  • CRIT Rate and Damage : Critical Rate determines the chance of dealing a CRIT ATK, while Critical Damage indicates the additional DMG dealt to an enemy with a CRIT ATK.
  • PEN and PEN Ratio : PEN is an abbreviation for Penetration. This stat gives the Agent’s damage the ability to pierce through the enemy’s defense. The PEN Ratio gauges the percentage of penetration on each enemy.
  • Energy Regeneration and Energy Regeneration Rate : By default, Agents regenerate their Energy by spending time on the battlefield or hitting enemies. Energy Regeneration indicates how quickly they can replenish this stat, while Energy Regeneration Rate determines the ratio at which an Agent regains their Energy.
  • Anomaly Mastery : Accelerates Anomaly Buildup Rate. (Agents with high Anomaly Mastery can inflict Attribute Anomaly debuff faster.)
  • Anomaly Proficiency : Enhances Attribute Anomaly Damage. (Agents with high Anomaly Proficiency deal more devastating debuffs.)
  • Attribute Damage Bonus : Each Agent can get additional damage for their Attribute, be it Physical, Fire, Ice, Electric, or Ether.

Agent Specialty

Each Agent in Zenless Zero Zone has a specialty that determines their role as a Stun, Attack, Support, Anomaly, or Defense character.

Stun

Agents with Stun Specialty can stagger enemies quickly, giving them the Daze stat much faster than other characters. (For example, Von Lycaon is a Stun specialist.)

Attack

Attack specialists deal more damage with base and special attacks than other agents.

Support

If an Agent’s Specialty is Support, they excel at buffing and healing the team.

Anomaly

Anomaly specialists inflict additional Attribute debuff on enemies, and their Attribute Anomaly Rate is higher than others by default.

Defense

Agents with Defense Specialty play the role of a tank. They are durable characters specializing in taking damage and dealing damage through counterattacks.

Damage-Deal Type

In Zenless Zone Zero , Agents deal damage in three distinctive ways: Strike, Slash, and Pierce. This is shown under their Specialty in the stats menu. Here’s what each damage-deal type indicates:

Strike

Strikers are close-range combatants. An Agent with a Strike damage-deal type uses fists and kicks to hit enemies.

Slash

Slashers are mid-range melee combatants. An Agent with a Slash damage-deal type uses swords or other melee weapons to hit enemies. (For example, Soldier 11 is a Slash-type damage dealer.)

Pierce

Piercers are long-range weapon-wielder combatants. If an Agent’s damage-deal type is Pierce, they use guns or projectiles to hit with enemies.

Additional Agent Abilities

In addition to all universal stats, Agents in Zenless Zone Zero can have hidden Additional Abilities. These abilities are triggered only when you have more than one Agent with similar Attributes or Factions on the team. Additional Abilities are often ATK, DEF, or HP bonuses that enhance the performance of one or all players on the team.

item.title: The Next Mass Effect's Companion Squad Size May Already Be Set in Stone
item.description:
Highlights

  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard's party size reduction may influence Mass Effect 4's setup.
  • If Mass Effect 4 were to have more than two companions at a time, The Veilguard likely would have offered three or more, as it would be easier for BioWare to carry any adjustments between the two games.
  • The fact that older Mass Effect games had two at a time, and that Dragon Age is moving from three companions down to two, makes it seem very likely for ME4 to keep the series' usual two companion limit. This may be the new standard for BioWare moving forward.

Following the reveal of Dragon Age: The Veilguard , BioWare seems to be ushering in new eras of its flagship IPs, which have undoubtedly faced uncertainty for years. There may not be anything known about Mass Effect 4 beyond the few bits of promotional material the project has received so far, but the promise of a new entry that takes gamers back to the Milky Way has more weight now that the next DA appears to be a tangible product. As changes to the formula of the studio's upcoming fantasy title have shown, however, Mass Effect 's established mechanics will likely continue to be influential in one key area.

Between the cinematic focus on dialogue and reduced party size, the gameplay showcase for the next DA has drawn some logical comparisons to the more streamlined action of Mass Effect over its roots in Origins . Since Mass Effect 4 is still far off given the current focus on Dragon Age , it's logical to assume that this dynamic could continue to work both ways, with the franchises taking inspiration from one another. Unless BioWare shifts gears and decides to take its properties in opposite directions from where they began, the party of The Veilguard is almost certain to inspire a similar setup in the next Mass Effect .

Dragon Age: The Veilguard's Party Has Slimmed Down to Mass Effect's Size

Previous Dragon Age Titles Featured Three Companions in the Field

Players of the existing trilogy are used to having access to three Dragon Age party members at a time, a number which is itself pared down from what older CRPGs were known for offering before it. Considering the depth typical of these characters and the variety they can provide in gameplay, it's become the norm that three can be used. While that franchise retained its party size despite shifting further toward action combat with each entry, Mass Effect has always stood in contrast through a nearly complete commitment to simplifying its RPG side.

There has been no subtle transition from the slower tactics of Origins to the fast-paced action of The Veilguard , but this change can at least partially be attributed to the growing success of Mass Effect . Every ME title has been limited to only two companions at a time who cannot be directly controlled outside of commands, but the intense combat scenarios of these games have kept them engaging for many RPG players regardless. Now that the latest Dragon Age in a decade is expected to follow suit, this is a pattern which might come to define the studio's style as a whole moving forward.

Chances of Mass Effect 4 Straying From a Succesful Formula Are Low

The Influence of The Veilguard's Eventual Reception

The reception to the sweeping changes which are set to define The Veilguard remains to be seen, but it's still safe to say that it's shaping up to be a massive release following a major undertaking. Even if it mainly captures a newer audience following the long hiatus between titles, the next Dragon Age could easily pave the way for the next Mass Effect to build upon its potentially fresh take on the action RPG genre.

It's not out of the question that ME4 could include three or more companions in battle after all, but a growing emphasis on the real-time capabilities of the protagonist instead is a trend which may yield results BioWare has been in need of. There's no shortage of customizable systems which inform the core combat of Dragon Age: The Veilguard 's diverse party outside what it has simplified, and there's no telling where Mass Effect 4 could take its own gameplay while still retaining its classic structure of a three-person squad.

item.title: 15 Best Games With Proximity Chat
item.description:
Highlights

  • Proximity chat has become an essential feature in many multiplayer games, allowing players to communicate effectively with their teammates and even with enemies. Here are some games that make use of proximity chat to enhance the gaming experience:
  • Onward - This first-person shooter game emphasizes communication between players, making proximity chat a crucial aspect of gameplay.
  • In Silence - In this horror game, one player controls the monster, while the others are survivors trying to escape. Proximity chat is essential for coordinating efforts and staying alive.

With the emergence and rising popularity of online games, third-party voice-chat systems such as Skype and Discord have become a must as they allow friends to coordinate their gameplay, and enjoy couch-co-op even across long distances. Some games capitalize on this, allowing players to chat with each other via a built-in game chat.

There are games that take it a step further with proximity chat. As the name suggests, this mode of voice chat allows players only to hear each other if their avatars are close enough in the game world. It adds a layer of realism that games can take full advantage of.

Updated July 6, 2024 by Mara Cowley : Online games continue to be popular, as they allow friends to communicate and play together when miles apart, or facilitate the means of making new friends. While most people may be tempted to use voice-chat software such as Discord to chat while playing with friends, some games utilize an in-game chat system that can enhance the players' experience, as it only works when their game avatars are close enough to hear one another, commonly referred to as proximity chat. This article already contained many great games with proximity chat , but with so many more experiences on the market, this article has been updated with a few more fantastic examples.

1 Content Warning

Create Fun And Engaging In-Game Content With Friends

Content Warning is a fun and new multiplayer horror game that allows up to four friends to realize their dream of being content creators. The catch is they can't do it from the safety of their home--they need to venture into dangerous territory to tape terrifying entities that may not be too pleased that intruders are trespassing into their lair and trying to film them.

The game itself actually captures players' gameplay and their voices as they try to farm more views for their videos. If all players want a share of the fame, they need to stick close to ensure their voice is captured.

2 The Outlast Trials

Communication Is Key For Survival And Objective Completion

Online titles have become one of the most popular styles of games, thanks to the spread of the internet, allowing players far and wide to enjoy experiences together. Studios that once developed single-player titles are now delving into the online world for a slice of the success, resulting in games such as The Outlast Trials .

Players take part in the eponymous trials, and though they can go alone, it's less dangerous to go with friends. In each trial, there is an objective that must be completed, but several terrifying enemies stand between them and the goal. To succeed, players need to stay close and communicate through in-game proximity chat. But, hearing their voices slowly fade into the distance as everybody splits up is a chilling experience. This is a horror game made for proximity chat.

3 Onward

Touted As A Realistic Shooter, The In-Game Chat Adds Further Realism

FPS games often try to aim for realism, giving players tense, adrenaline-fueled gameplay for a thrilling experience that will keep them coming back for more. The emergence of VR technology has allowed developers to add a whole new layer of realism, as it places players right into the world, through the eyes of one of the gunmen.

Onward takes this a step further even, with proximity chat meaning players can only hear one another if they are in range. Whether it is in co-op mode or PVP, players are sure to feel immersed in the world of Onward . Communication is also the key to success, adding just another reason why the proximity chat in this title is so important and meaningful.

4 In Silence

The Monster Can Hear The Players, As They Work Together Or Against Each Other

  • Platforms: PC, Mac
  • Released: 16 October 2020
  • Developers: Ravenhood Games
  • Genre: Action, Horror

This multiplayer horror game sees one player taking control of the creature, and 2-6 other players take on the role of the hapless survivors who are looking for their means of escape from the woods, and the monster prowling among them.

Almost completely blind, the monster relies on sound to hunt, namely those of the survivors' actions and voices, as this is where the proximity chat comes into play. Players will need to communicate via voice chat to coordinate their efforts if they have any chance to survive, but the player controlling the monster also has access to it, allowing them to hear their chat and even join in themselves to taunt or scare the other players.

5 Forewarned

A Terrifying Multiplayer Horror Experience Set In Ancient Ruins, Coordination Is Key

  • Platforms: PC
  • Released: 10 September 2021
  • Developers: Dreambyte Games
  • Genre: Adventure

Similar to Phasmophobia , Forewarned sees a group of intrepid explorers entering haunted premises and using equipment to find evidence to diagnose the entity, with an Egyptian theme, unlike the aforementioned game.

Players entering these ancient ruins must use proximity chat to corroborate their efforts in gathering evidence and exploring the ruins so they can know what the entity is, and know how to best deal with it while hopefully keeping themselves alive. Should players stray too far, they can use a walkie-talkie to keep in contact, which adds a layer of realism and immersion to this horrifying experience.

6 Hell Let Loose

This WW2 Online Shooter Offers One of the Most in-depth Chat Systems For Clean Conversation

Shooting games set during WW2 are unique by any measure, but Hell Let Loose sets itself apart by being an online experience of impressive scope. 50 players take on another 50, choosing to be part of the American, British, Soviet, or German army, and attempt to win against the opposing side by using all the weapons in their arsenal.

Considering the number of players, one would think the proximity chat would be illegible with too many overlapping voices, but developers over at Black Matter cleverly handled this, with one person in charge giving orders and organizing their units via the leadership voice channel, each unit able to communicate with each other in the unit proximity chat, and a party chat also implemented for friends to be able to communicate.

7 Holdfast: Nations at War

A Multi-Faceted Historic Multiplayer With Chaotic In-Game Chat

  • Platforms: PC
  • Released: 21 September 2017
  • Developers: Anvil Game Studio
  • Genre: Shooter, Massively Multiplayer

Part multiplayer, part shooter, part RPG, Holdfast: Nations at War is sure to appease most gamers. Players will immerse themselves in historic battles using the weaponry of the time in servers of up to 150 other players, ensuring tense and thrilling battles down to the last men standing.

Proximity chat is unlimited in the game servers, allowing anyone and everyone to engage in chat, mobilizing allies or antagonizing their enemies. With no limitations, restrictions or organizations, the voice chat can be chaotic, but adds more realism, as everyone would be talking over each other in times of war.

8 V Rising

Many Different and Fun Aspects of this Survival RPG Help To Forge New Alliances

Vampire enthusiasts haven't been forgotten either with the brilliant V Rising , which sees players don the fangs of a recently awakened vampire that fell into a prolonged slumber. There are many different aspects to the survival RPG, such as drinking different blood types with unique bonuses, building up a castle and shoring up its defenses, and dipping into the PVP mode to take on other vampires.

In PVP mode, players can use a built-in proximity chat to converse with the other players, and perhaps find ones who might be willing to team up. This is a great way to make new allies in the game who could potentially become a new friend to play more games with.

9 Rust

A Tough, Yet Rewarding Survival Game To Make Alliances Or Rivals

This multiplayer open-world survival game has only one main objective, which is to survive whatever dangers come the players' way, but it will in no way be easy. Everything in this world wants players to die, from the flora and fauna to the other players populating the world.

Players must do whatever it takes to survive this hostile world, such as finding supplies to aid them, killing dangerous enemies, and communicating with allies to coordinate their efforts. Fortunately, proximity chat is built into the game so players can speak with their allies to improve their chances of survival, but they should be wary of what or who might be listening to their communications.

10 Phasmophobia

A Horrifying Ghost Hunting Game Sure To Terrify The Bravest Souls As Players Collect Evidence On The Ghost Type

Ghost-hunting fans rejoice! There is one excellent ghost game that makes use of proximity chat, and that is Phasmophobia . In this title, players are in the shoes of a group of vastly underpaid ghost hunters who use the tools at their disposal to investigate what sort of ghost is hunting the premises.

With multiple maps and over 20 total ghosts, players might have a hard time figuring out what ghost they may be dealing with and must work together to lift the mask. With built-in proximity voice chat and a long-distance radio chat, players can easily corroborate their efforts through the trial even when they are far apart, but they should take care, as often lone targets are easily killed by the ghost, especially if they are unaware during a ghost hunt, as the ghost will track their voice.

11 Escape From Tarkov

A Realistic PVP Shooter Where Communication With Friends Is Essential

This PVP shooter brings fast-paced adrenaline-pumping action to players, which the developers herald as being "realistic." Players can choose one of three modes: temporary offline, online PMC raids, or Scav, short for scavenger. Players can choose to go it solo or team up with their friends to further their chances of survival.

Proximity chat is just another weapon in the player and their adversaries' arsenal, as it allows them to more effectively cooperate with their friends as they attempt to gun down rival gangs, but the other players will also be coordinating with their teammates, which adds another layer of difficulty. In the end, it will come down to which player is more skilled, and a dash of luck for good measure.

12 Hunt: Showdown

A Fun Monster & Player Hunting Game With A Unique Setting

Step back in time with this rootin-tootin-shootin' game that pits players against players as well as events. Supernatural monsters have been unleashed upon Victorian-era Louisiana, but that's where the hunters come into play, teaming up with other hunters, arming themselves to the teeth, and then hunting down the creatures in question. But, the player and their friends will be in a race against other players and their friends who are tracking the same quarry. Speed, skill, and cooperation are a must.

Thankfully, Hunt: Showdown allows players the use of proximity chat so they can work together to track down their prey before other hunters snipe at them or their hunting target, but other hunters who are close enough could also potentially overhear the words and use them to their advantage.

13 Sea Of Thieves

Boundless Freedom Where Players Communicate As Pirates

For those who want something less horrifying, Sea of Thieves is here to save the day. Sail the seas as a crew of scallywags looting and exploring the world, and even encountering other pirates. With no set roles for players to fight over, they are free to choose what to do which offers a fantastic amount of freedom.

With proximity voice chat in play, they can make use of this to coordinate gameplay, speak with other crews, or even belt out their favorite sea shanties to immerse themselves in this multiplayer pirate game. There have been multiple hilarious Sea of Thieves videos involving proximity chat. Whether that's a Pirates of the Caribbean -inspired fight or a simple joyous shanty.

14 Lethal Company

A Scary And Challenging Roguelike Treasure Hunting Game To Help Or Hinder Friends

Lethal Company has drawn in a lot of players thanks to its fantastic gameplay that can enjoyed with up to three other players. The players scavenge for scrap on abandoned moons to sell to the Company, but these moons may not be so abandoned after all.

Traps and dangerous creatures both present threats to the players, but thanks to the proximity chat players can warn their friends of any dangers that may be up ahead...or they can have a little fun and prank their friends, hindering their progress.

15 Call Of Duty Warzone 2.0

A Free Battle Royale In The Call Of Duty Universe

The Call of Duty series delved into the rich and ripe battle royale mode, releasing Warzone 2.0 back in 2022 to much fanfare and success. Considering its fanbase adores shooter games and the multiplayer aspects of CoD , it made sense for the franchise to move in this direction, allowing players to enjoy a CoD-themed battle royale game for free.

Players will be dropped into a map that continually shrinks as they try to gun each other down to earn the title of being the last one standing. The inclusion of proximity chat makes it all the more chaotic and fun, as the players will bring great energy, jokes, and smack-talk to the voice chat, as well as useful information such as locations of enemies players can use to their advantage.
